Class: Broker

Broker(configuration)

Creates a new broker

Constructor

new Broker(configuration)

Parameters:
Name Type Description
configuration Object

configuration (configuration) of the broker

Properties
Name Type Description
port number | string

port number the broker will listen on
persistInterval number

in milliseconds. Intervall between persisting internal state to file
connections Object

connection settings for the broker

Properties
Name Type Attributes Default Description
fileName string

filename for persistence
directory string

directory (file path) for persistence
replyTimeoutInMilliseconds number

timeout to wait for an answer of a http call
inFlightWindow number <optional>
 1

amount of qos 1 and qos 2 messages send for the same topic at the same time
pubrelTimeoutInMilliseconds number <optional>
 one day

temeout to wait for a corresponding pubrel message
maxRetryCount number

amount of resend of messages before forcing a disconnect
maxQueuSize number

maximal amount of entries in a message queue
log Object

log settings
Source:
  • broker.js, line 127
Example
const configuration = {
     port: 10000,
     persistInterval: 0,
     connections: {
          directory: '.',
          fileName: 'broker',
          log: [
              {
                  module: 'received',
                  topic: '#'
              }
          ]
      }
  }
const broker = new Broker(configuration)
broker.run()

Methods

(async) close()

Closes the broker, stops listening

Source:
  • broker.js, line 205

connect(host, port)

Connects to a friendly broker and subscribs for all messages

Parameters:
Name Type Description
host string

name of the host (or his ip)
port number

port number to connect to
Source:
  • broker.js, line 174

on(event, callback)

Sets a callback.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
event string

callback name (supports 'send' and 'publish') 'send' is called to send data. This function is provided by the broker but could be overwritten 'publish' is called on receiving data. This function if provided by the broker but could be overwritten
callback function
Source:
  • broker.js, line 188
Throws:

  • if the event is not supported

    Type
    Error

  • if the callback is not 'function'

    Type
    Error

run()

Starts the broker. It will listen to message, send messages and periodically store its status

Source:
  • broker.js, line 193
